abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            rated as satisfactory. Key lessons from the implementation
            of the project include: 1) All projects aiming at improving
            processes must be based on an explicit consensus among
            stakeholders and on a detailed assessment of their
            respective capacities. 2) The supervision of a
            multi-sectoral project is quite time-consuming on the
            Bank's side, even if project management performance is
            satisfactory. It requires a well-functioning country team,
            budgetary cross-support, and effective coordination
            arrangements for following-up studies execution and
            conclusions dissemination. 3) The preparation of sectoral
            strategies in sectors where the Government's role and
            responsibilities are rapidly evolving requires first
            building consensus and awareness among public stakeholders.
            4) Genuinely-committed Borrowers may fully finance
            incremental operating costs related to project management,
            if the Bank does not assume a priori that this is the
            Bank's responsibility.

docna.cdata!:
Benin - Pre-Investment Project : Credit 2286
            - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Benin - Pre-Investment Project :
            Credit 2286 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will have both immediate and
            long-term objectives: first, to relieve the immediate
            constraints on investments caused by the lack of properly
            prepared projects; and, second, create the institutional
            capacity for identifying investment proposals and processing
            them through feasibility studies, obtaining financing and
            establishing final project execution plans. To meet these
            objectives the project will comprise the following
            components: (a) an institutional strengthening component in
            the form of on-the-job training and technical assistance
            provided to the Ministry of Planning and Statistics and the
            planning units of the technical ministries; (b) an
            investment preparation component in the form of
            identification work, feasibility studies and detailed
            execution plans of projects included in the public
            investment program; and (c) a sectoral priorities component
            in the form of studies to upgrade the available information
            on sectoral investment priorities and to develop sectoral strategies.
